column4: This is the second time im installing ubuntu on the same computer, could that be the issue?
speaks of your skill, but no; there is no limit as to the number of installs one might preform on one box.
did you set up a user account ?

ok.  do this.  hit [alt] +[F2]    [enter]    and type 'chroot /target passwd '   and type in a root password.  then [alt] +[f1]    and skip that step. go on with the install.   (assuming the password is set without error.)   then after you finish the install and reboot come back and we can clean that up.
